revised_title: The Sensitiveness of Silver and Other Metals to Light: A Historical Overview
tldr: This article discusses the historical understanding of the sensitivity of silver and other metals to light. It explores various experiments and observations conducted by different scientists, including Moser's experiment in 1842, which demonstrated the direct action of light on metallic silver. The article also examines the role of light sensitivity in the development of the Daguerreotype process and the potential applications of this phenomenon in photography and other fields.
